body: Please upgrade to latest version (or master) and check if the issue is still valid.
@samdark Yes, i upgrade the version to 2.0.13.1, it still valid.

rename.from: [Yii2][2.0.6][yii\db\ActiveRelationTrait] ActiveRecord Relation Query Missing Some Data
rename.to: [yii\db\ActiveRelationTrait] ActiveRecord Relation Query Missing Some Data

body: How do you perform the query?
Yes, i found some infomation in [stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14802680/array-unique-sort-regular-flag), it seems `SORT_REGULAR` is the same as an equality check with `==`
@cebe git blame shows that you've touched this code last. Long time ago but still, do you remember why we're doing `SORT_REGULAR`?

it was introduced in https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/23572c74cdd791005e79db7141405624c74de1ea#diff-cbb917fbe0fb0627cd1b6fa3ac6b2d8aR250 no reason given, but I assume it is about comparing integer `1` and string `'1'`. That should still work with `SORT_STRING` so I think its okay to change it.

issue.title: Fixes #15482: AR::find()->with() missing data when using string identifiers for relations

repository.name: yii2

issue.body:
Latest stable release is from March.
There have been quite some bugfixes.

2.0.16 was scheduled for 3rd quarter 
- https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/ROADMAP.md
- https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/milestone/25
  Issues should be moved to 2.0.17

I think it also makes sense to have a `2.x` branch.

https://github.com/orgs/yiisoft/projects/14
